p: Data were presented in the form of tables and graphs. Results were presented as mean ± SEM. For anti-inflammatory analysis, one-way analysis of variance (ANOVA) was used to analyse and compare the data, followed by Dunnett’s test for multiple comparisons among groups. p < 0.05 was taken as the limit of significance in all cases. Statistical analyses were made using GraphPad Prism version 5.00 for Windows (GraphPad Software, La Jolla, CA, USA).
